events.message: The applicant has successfully submitted the personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and pay off some existing debt.
The application has been categorized under Personal Loan as it mentions medical and debt consolidation purposes.
Loan officer Sarah Jenkins has been assigned to oversee the application and communicate with the applicant for further steps.
Initial review completed indicating that the applicant meets the basic eligibility criteria but requires additional documents.
Applicant has been requested to provide recent medical bills, income proof, and current debt statements for verification purposes.
Applicant submitted all requested documents including income tax returns, medical invoices, and outstanding debt details.
Credit bureau report has been obtained showing a good history but some recent high outstanding balances.
Risk assessment evaluated the likelihood of repayment, factoring in current debt levels and stable employment.
A loan offer of $25,000 with an interest rate of 8% per annum was presented to the applicant for review.
The applicant responded positively, requesting clarification on the repayment schedule and confirming willingness to proceed.
Application was escalated to the senior credit committee to approve the requested loan amount given the medical nature.
The senior credit committee approved the loan application after reviewing all documents and risk factors thoroughly.
The approved loan amount of $25,000 was disbursed to the applicantâ€™s specified bank account successfully.
Follow-up call scheduled to ensure applicant has received funds and address any queries about repayment terms.
The loan application process was formally closed after successful funding and follow-up with the applicant.
